name: Solang Valley
description: Adventure hub offering paragliding, zorbing, and skiing with stunning Himalayan views.

name: Hadimba Temple
description: Ancient 16th-century wooden temple dedicated to Hidimba Devi, surrounded by cedar forests.

name: Rohtang Pass
description: Breathtaking high mountain pass at 3,978m offering snow activities and panoramic views.

name: Manu Temple
description: Sacred temple dedicated to Sage Manu, believed to be the creator of human race in Hinduism.

name: Vashisht Hot Springs
description: Natural sulfur-rich hot water springs with ancient stone baths and temple complex.

name: Old Manali
description: Bohemian village area with charming cafes, apple orchards, and hippie culture vibe.

name: Baga Beach
description: Vibrant beach famous for water sports, nightlife, and beach shacks serving fresh seafood.

name: Fort Aguada
description: 17th-century Portuguese fort with lighthouse offering panoramic views of Arabian Sea.

name: Dudhsagar Falls
description: Majestic 4-tiered waterfall cascading from 310m height amidst lush Western Ghats.

name: Basilica of Bom Jesus
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site housing the mortal remains of St. Francis Xavier.

name: Anjuna Flea Market
description: Colorful Wednesday market selling handicrafts, clothes, and souvenirs since 1960s.

name: Palolem Beach
description: Scenic crescent-shaped beach with calm waters, perfect for swimming and kayaking.

name: Hawa Mahal
description: Iconic 'Palace of Winds' with 953 intricately carved windows for royal women to observe streets.

name: Amber Fort
description: Magnificent hilltop fort-palace with mirror work, elephant rides, and light show at night.

name: City Palace
description: Royal residence with museums showcasing Rajput artifacts, weapons, and royal costumes.

name: Jantar Mantar
description: UNESCO-listed 18th-century astronomical observatory with massive stone instruments.

name: Nahargarh Fort
description: Hilltop fort offering panoramic city views and famous for its 'Padao' restaurant.

name: Johari Bazaar
description: Jaipur's most famous jewelry market specializing in Kundan, Meenakari, and gemstones.

name: Red Fort
description: UNESCO World Heritage Site - Mughal emperor Shah Jahan's iconic red sandstone fortress.

name: Qutub Minar
description: 73m tall victory tower built in 1193, the world's tallest brick minaret with intricate carvings.

name: India Gate
description: War memorial arch honoring soldiers, surrounded by lawns and popular evening picnic spot.

name: Lotus Temple
description: Stunning Bahá'í House of Worship shaped like a lotus flower, open to all religions.

name: Chandni Chowk
description: Historic 17th-century market offering street food, spices, textiles, and chaotic charm.

name: Humayun's Tomb
description: UNESCO-listed Mughal garden tomb that inspired the Taj Mahal's architecture.

name: Mall Road
description: Shimla's vibrant main street lined with colonial buildings, shops, cafes, and restaurants.

name: Jakhoo Temple
description: Ancient hilltop temple dedicated to Hanuman with giant statue and panoramic views.

name: Kufri
description: Scenic hill station near Shimla offering skiing, yak rides, and Himalayan wildlife zoo.

name: Christ Church
description: Second oldest church in North India with neo-gothic architecture and stained glass windows.

name: Shimla State Museum
description: Showcases Himachal's cultural heritage with ancient sculptures, paintings, and coins.

name: The Ridge
description: Large open space in heart of Shimla offering panoramic mountain views and cultural events.
